questions.question: What is the primary method used to enhance the photothermal conversion of tetrathiafulvalene-based MOFs?
questions.answer: The primary method used to enhance the photothermal conversion of tetrathiafulvalene-based MOFs is by redox doping and using plasmonic nanoparticles.

questions.question: What are the two strategies usually adopted to endow MOFs with photothermal properties?
questions.answer: The two strategies are incorporating plasmonic metal nanoparticles in the pore space of MOFs and designing organic functional moieties with near-infrared adsorption into the ligands that make up the MOF scaffold.

questions.question: How does the incorporation of Ag nanoparticles influence the photothermal performance of Dy-m-TTFTB?
questions.answer: The incorporation of Ag nanoparticles enhances the photothermal performance of Dy-m-TTFTB through surface plasmon resonance, leading to a higher temperature increase compared to the material without Ag nanoparticles.

questions.question: What is the role of TTFc+ radicals in the photothermal conversion of Dy-m-TTFTB and its derivatives?
questions.answer: TTFc+ radicals contribute to the enhanced NIR adsorption and photothermal properties by suppressing the photon emission process and improving the photothermal efficiency.

questions.question: True or False: The photothermal conversion of Dy-m-TTFTB is limited by its low light absorption at 808 nm.
What is the maximum temperature increase achieved by Ag NPs@Dy-m-TTFTB under 808 nm laser irradiation with an energy power of 0.7 W cm−2?
questions.answer: The maximum temperature increase achieved by Ag NPs@Dy-m-TTFTB under 808 nm laser irradiation with an energy power of 0.7 W cm−2 is 239.8 °C.

questions.question: True or False: The oxidation of Dy-m-TTFTB by I2 and Ag+ does not change the framework structure of the material.
What experimental techniques were used to confirm the successful oxidation of TTF to TTFc+ radicals in Dy-m-TTFTB?
questions.answer: The successful oxidation of TTF to TTFc+ radicals in Dy-m-TTFTB was confirmed using electron paramagnetic resonance (EPR) signal and single-crystal XRD data.

questions.question: True or False: The photothermal conversion efficiency of Dy-m-TTFTB can be solely attributed to the presence of TTFc+ radicals.
How does the presence of Ag nanoparticles and TTFc+ radicals synergistically enhance the photothermal effect in Ag NPs@Dy-m-TTFTB?
questions.answer: The presence of Ag nanoparticles enhances the photothermal effect through surface plasmon resonance, while TTFc+ radicals contribute by improving NIR adsorption and photothermal efficiency, leading to a synergistic enhancement in the photothermal effect.
